extension.name: com.acme.nifi.processors.EnhancedPutSQL
extension.description: Executes a SQL UPDATE or INSERT command with enhanced validation for source, target, and engine databases. The content of an incoming FlowFile is expected to be the SQL command to execute. The SQL command may use the ? to escape parameters. Parameters must exist as FlowFile attributes with the naming convention sql.args.N.type and sql.args.N.value, where N is a positive integer. The sql.args.N.type is expected to be a number indicating the JDBC Type. The content of the FlowFile is expected to be in UTF-8 format.

property.name: JDBC Connection Pool
property.description: Specifies the JDBC Connection Pool to use in order to execute the SQL statement.

property.name: putsql-sql-statement
property.description: The SQL statement to execute. If not specified, the content of the incoming FlowFile is expected to contain a valid SQL statement.

property.name: Support Fragmented Transactions
property.description: If true, processes FlowFiles with the same fragment.identifier as a single transaction, sorted by fragment.index.

property.name: database-session-autocommit
property.description: The autocommit mode to set on the database connection. If false, operations will be explicitly committed or rolled back.

property.name: Transaction Timeout
property.description: If Support Fragment Transactions is true, specifies how long to wait for all FlowFiles with a particular fragment.identifier.

property.name: Batch Size
property.description: The preferred number of FlowFiles to put to the database in a single transaction

property.name: Obtain Generated Keys
property.description: If true, adds the generated key to the FlowFile using the sql.generated.key attribute.

property.name: Rollback On Failure
property.description: If true, the session will be rolled back on any failure, ensuring atomicity.

property.name: Operation ID
property.description: Operation identifier used to validate the source and target database for this migration

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: FlowFiles that failed and will not succeed on retry

relationship.name: retry
relationship.description: FlowFiles that failed but may succeed on retry

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: FlowFiles successfully updated in the database

readsAttribute.name: fragment.identifier
readsAttribute.description: If the <Support Fragment Transactions> property is true, this attribute is used to determine whether or not two FlowFiles belong to the same transaction.

readsAttribute.name: fragment.count
readsAttribute.description: If the <Support Fragment Transactions> property is true, this attribute is used to determine how many FlowFiles are needed to complete the transaction.

readsAttribute.name: fragment.index
readsAttribute.description: If the <Support Fragment Transactions> property is true, this attribute is used to determine the order that the FlowFiles in a transaction should be evaluated.

readsAttribute.name: sql.args.N.type
readsAttribute.description: Incoming FlowFiles are expected to be parametrized SQL statements. The type of each Parameter is specified as an integer that represents the JDBC Type of the parameter.

readsAttribute.name: sql.args.N.value
readsAttribute.description: Incoming FlowFiles are expected to be parametrized SQL statements. The value of the Parameters are specified as sql.args.1.value, sql.args.2.value, sql.args.3.value, and so on. The type of the sql.args.1.value Parameter is specified by the sql.args.1.type attribute.

readsAttribute.name: sql.args.N.format
readsAttribute.description: This attribute is always optional, but default options may not always work for your data. Incoming FlowFiles are expected to be parametrized SQL statements. In some cases a format option needs to be specified, currently this is only applicable for binary data types, dates, times and timestamps.

writesAttribute.name: sql.generated.key
writesAttribute.description: If the database generated a key for an INSERT statement and the Obtain Generated Keys property is set to true, this attribute will be added to indicate the generated key, if possible. This feature is not supported by all database vendors.
